# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width=10)
    lines = []
    words = split(text)

    for word in words
        if length(string(word)) + length(lines[end]) > text_width
            push!(lines, "\n")
        end

            lines.pop()
        else
            push!(lines, string(word)))
        end
    end
    return join(lines, " "))
end

# Example usage:
text = "This is a long example text to demonstrate the wrapping function. The maximum text width will be 15 characters."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped_text)
```

In this example, the `wrap_string` function takes a string and a maximum text width as inputs. It splits the input text into words and wraps each word onto a new line if it would exceed the `text_width`. The final wrapped text is returned by the function.
